root.name: Sega GT 2002
root.description: Sega GT 2002 was initially planned as a DreamCast release, like its predecessor Sega GT. As the DreamCast discontinued in 2001, the game saw an Xbox release instead. Sega GT 2002 and Jet Set Radio Future were merged into one disc and sold bundled with specially marked Xbox packages. A year later, Sega GT Online was released, which added online play and more content.Sega GT 2002 met criticism from car enthusiasts who noticed an improper portrayal of classic muscle cars, like the Dodge Charger with 700 horsepowers that players found useless against weaker opponents in the game's quarter-mile drag races.The game introduced some elements that were new for its time, like the ability to select selling price for vehicles, customizing your garage and the use of classic Japanese cars.
